conclusion: Analyze the circuit in both states: when the switch is open and when it is closed.
The voltmeter reads 6V when the switch S is open.
The circuit consists of the battery (ε), internal resistance (r), and the 20Ω resistor in series.
Determine the total voltage of the battery (ε) using Ohm's Law: ε = 0.3A × (r + 20Ω).
When the switch S is closed, the 10Ω resistor is in parallel with the 20Ω resistor.
Calculate the equivalent resistance of the parallel combination: R_eq = 6.67Ω.
Total resistance in the circuit is R_total = r + 6.67Ω.
Determine the current when S is closed: I = (0.3A × (r + 20Ω)) / (r + 6.67Ω).
Voltage between points a and b is V_ab = I × R_eq.
Substitute the expression for I: V_ab = 0.3A × ((r + 20Ω) × 6.67Ω) / (r + 6.67Ω).
Internal resistance r is not given, so the exact voltage cannot be determined.
